parameter.name: ctl_bw
parameter.long_desc: Speed controller bandwidth, in Hz. Higher values result in faster speed and current rise times, but may result in overshoot and higher current consumption. For fixed-wing aircraft, this value should be less than 50 Hz; for multirotors, values up to 100 Hz may provide improvements in responsiveness.

parameter.name: ctl_dir
parameter.long_desc: Motor spin direction as detected during initial enumeration. Use 0 or 1 to reverse direction.

parameter.name: ctl_gain
parameter.long_desc: Speed (RPM) controller gain. Determines controller aggressiveness; units are amp-seconds per radian. Systems with higher rotational inertia (large props) will need gain increased; systems with low rotational inertia (small props) may need gain decreased. Higher values result in faster response, but may result in oscillation and excessive overshoot. Lower values result in a slower, smoother response.

parameter.name: ctl_hz_idle
parameter.long_desc: Idle speed (e Hz)

parameter.name: ctl_start_rate
parameter.long_desc: Spin-up rate (e Hz/s)

parameter.name: esc_index
parameter.short_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.
parameter.long_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.

parameter.name: id_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status ID

parameter.name: int_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status interval (µs)

parameter.name: int_status
parameter.long_desc: ESC status interval (µs)

parameter.name: mot_i_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor current limit in amps. This determines the maximum current controller setpoint, as well as the maximum allowable current setpoint slew rate. This value should generally be set to the continuous current rating listed in the motor’s specification sheet, or set equal to the motor’s specified continuous power divided by the motor voltage limit.

parameter.name: mot_kv
parameter.short_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt
parameter.long_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt. This can be taken from the motor’s specification sheet; accuracy will help control performance but some deviation from the specified value is acceptable.

parameter.name: mot_ls
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries.
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries. This is measured on start-up.

parameter.name: mot_num_poles
parameter.long_desc: Number of motor poles. Used to convert mechanical speeds to electrical speeds. This number should be taken from the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_rs
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms. This is measured on start-up. When tuning a new motor, check that this value is approximately equal to the value shown in the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_v_accel
parameter.long_desc: Acceleration limit (V)

parameter.name: mot_v_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor voltage limit in volts. The current controller’s commanded voltage will never exceed this value. Note that this may safely be above the nominal voltage of the motor; to determine the actual motor voltage limit, divide the motor’s rated power by the motor current limit.

parameter.name: gnss.dyn_model
parameter.long_desc: Dynamic model used in the GNSS positioning engine. 0 – Automotive, 1 – Sea, 2 – Airborne.

parameter.name: gnss.old_fix_msg
parameter.long_desc: Broadcast the old (deprecated) GNSS fix message uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix alongside the new alternative uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix2. It is recommended to disable this feature to reduce the CAN bus traffic.

parameter.name: gnss.warn_dimens
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the dimensionality of the GNSS solution is less than this value. 3 for the full (3D) solution, 2 for planar (2D) solution, 1 for time-only solution, 0 disables the feature.

parameter.name: gnss.warn_sats
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero disables the feature

parameter.name: uavcan.pubp-pres
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero disables the feature

parameter.name: BAT1_CAPACITY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of battery 1 in mAh.

parameter.name: BAT1_N_CELLS
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT1_R_INTERNAL
parameter.short_desc: Explicitly defines the per cell internal resistance for battery 1
parameter.long_desc: If non-negative, then this will be used in place of BAT1_V_LOAD_DROP for all calculations.

parameter.name: BAT1_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages. If the value is set to 'ESCs', the battery information are taken from the esc_status message. This requires the ESC to provide both voltage as well as current.

parameter.name: BAT1_V_CHARGED
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of battery 1 is considered full under a mild load. This will never be the nominal voltage of 4.2V

parameter.name: BAT1_V_EMPTY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of battery 1 is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen before the steep dropoff to 2.8V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameter.name: BAT1_V_LOAD_DROP
parameter.short_desc: Voltage drop per cell on full throttle
parameter.long_desc: This implicitely defines the internal resistance to maximum current ratio for battery 1 and assumes linearity. A good value to use is the difference between the 5C and 20-25C load. Not used if BAT1_R_INTERNAL is set.

parameter.name: BAT2_CAPACITY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of battery 2 in mAh.

parameter.name: BAT2_N_CELLS
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT2_R_INTERNAL
parameter.short_desc: Explicitly defines the per cell internal resistance for battery 2
parameter.long_desc: If non-negative, then this will be used in place of BAT2_V_LOAD_DROP for all calculations.

parameter.name: BAT2_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages. If the value is set to 'ESCs', the battery information are taken from the esc_status message. This requires the ESC to provide both voltage as well as current.

parameter.name: BAT2_V_CHARGED
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of battery 1 is considered full under a mild load. This will never be the nominal voltage of 4.2V

parameter.name: BAT2_V_EMPTY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of battery 1 is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen before the steep dropoff to 2.8V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameter.name: BAT2_V_LOAD_DROP
parameter.short_desc: Voltage drop per cell on full throttle
parameter.long_desc: This implicitely defines the internal resistance to maximum current ratio for battery 1 and assumes linearity. A good value to use is the difference between the 5C and 20-25C load. Not used if BAT2_R_INTERNAL is set.

parameter.name: BAT_CAPACITY
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_CAPACITY instead
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of battery 1.

parameter.name: BAT_CRIT_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as critically low. This has to be lower than the low threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger RTL.

parameter.name: BAT_EMERGEN_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as dangerously low. This has to be lower than the critical threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger landing.

parameter.name: BAT_LOW_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as low. This has to be higher than the critical threshold.

parameter.name: BAT_N_CELLS
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_N_CELLS instead
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT_R_INTERNAL
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_R_INTERNAL instead
parameter.long_desc: If non-negative, then this will be used in place of BAT_V_LOAD_DROP for all calculations.

parameter.name: BAT_SOURCE
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_SOURCE instead
parameter.long_desc: Battery monitoring source. This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages.

parameter.name: BAT_V_CHARGED
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_V_CHARGED instead
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of battery 1 is considered full under a mild load. This will never be the nominal voltage of 4.2V

parameter.name: BAT_V_EMPTY
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_V_EMPTY instead
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of battery 1 is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen before the steep dropoff to 2.8V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameter.name: BAT_V_LOAD_DROP
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_V_LOAD_DROP instead
parameter.long_desc: This implicitely defines the internal resistance to maximum current ratio for battery 1 and assumes linearity. A good value to use is the difference between the 5C and 20-25C load. Not used if BAT_R_INTERNAL is set.

parameter.name: CBRK_AIRSPD_CHK
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 162128 will disable the check for an airspeed sensor. The sensor driver will not be started and it cannot be calibrated. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_BUZZER
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 782097 will disable the buzzer audio notification. Setting this parameter to 782090 will disable the startup tune, while keeping all others enabled.

parameter.name: CBRK_ENGINEFAIL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for engine failure detection
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 284953 will disable the engine failure detection. If the aircraft is in engine failure mode the engine failure flag will be set to healthy WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_FLIGHTTERM
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 121212 will disable the flight termination action if triggered by the FailureDetector logic or if FMU is lost. This circuit breaker does not affect the RC loss, data link loss, geofence, and takeoff failure detection safety logic.

parameter.name: CBRK_IO_SAFETY
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 22027 will disable IO safety. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_RATE_CTRL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for rate controller output
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 140253 will disable the rate controller uORB publication. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for power supply check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 894281 will disable the power valid checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_USB_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for USB link check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 197848 will disable the USB connected checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_VELPOSERR
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for position error check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 201607 will disable the position and velocity accuracy checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_VTOLARMING
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for arming in fixed-wing mode check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 159753 will enable arming in fixed-wing mode for VTOLs. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: MC_AIRMODE
parameter.long_desc: The air-mode enables the mixer to increase the total thrust of the multirotor in order to keep attitude and rate control even at low and high throttle. This function should be disabled during tuning as it will help the controller to diverge if the closed-loop is unstable (i.e. the vehicle is not tuned yet). Enabling air-mode for yaw requires the use of an arming switch.

parameter.name: MOT_ORDERING
parameter.long_desc: Determines the motor ordering. This can be used for example in combination with a 4-in-1 ESC that assumes a motor ordering which is different from PX4. ONLY supported for Quads. When changing this, make sure to test the motor response without props first.

parameter.name: CP_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Average delay of the range sensor message plus the tracking delay of the position controller in seconds
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode.

parameter.name: CP_DIST
parameter.short_desc: Minimum distance the vehicle should keep to all obstacles
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode. Collision avoidance is disabled by setting this parameter to a negative value

parameter.name: CP_GO_NO_DATA
parameter.short_desc: Boolean to allow moving into directions where there is no sensor data (outside FOV)
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode.

parameter.name: CP_GUIDE_ANG
parameter.short_desc: Angle left/right from the commanded setpoint by which the collision prevention algorithm can choose to change the setpoint direction
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode.

parameter.name: WV_ROLL_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum roll angle setpoint for weathervane controller to demand a yaw-rate

parameter.name: WV_YRATE_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum yawrate the weathervane controller is allowed to demand

parameter.name: MOT_SLEW_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Minimum motor rise time (slew rate limit)
parameter.long_desc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through a range of 1000 PWM units. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 1000 to 2000 PWM in maximum x seconds. Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.

parameter.name: THR_MDL_FAC
parameter.short_desc: Thrust to motor control signal model parameter
parameter.long_desc: Parameter used to model the nonlinear relationship between motor control signal (e.g. PWM) and static thrust. The model is: rel_thrust = factor * rel_signal^2 + (1-factor) * rel_signal, where rel_thrust is the normalized thrust between 0 and 1, and rel_signal is the relative motor control signal between 0 and 1.

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOCONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to reset parameters on next system startup (setting defaults). Platform-specific values are used if available. RC* parameters are preserved.

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOSTART
parameter.long_desc: CHANGING THIS VALUE REQUIRES A RESTART. Defines the auto-start script used to bootstrap the system.

parameter.name: SYS_BL_UPDATE
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, update the bootloader on the next boot. WARNING: do not cut the power during an update process, otherwise you will have to recover using some alternative method (e.g. JTAG). Instructions: - Insert an SD card - Enable this parameter - Reboot the board (plug the power or send a reboot command) - Wait until the board comes back up (or at least 2 minutes) - If it does not come back, check the file bootlog.txt on the SD card

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_ACCEL
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of accelerometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_BARO
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of barometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_GYRO
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of rate gyro thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TDEL
parameter.short_desc: Required temperature rise during thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: A temperature increase greater than this value is required during calibration. Calibration will complete for each sensor when the temperature increase above the starting temeprature exceeds the value set by SYS_CAL_TDEL. If the temperature rise is insufficient, the calibration will continue indefinitely and the board will need to be repowered to exit.

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: Temperature calibration will not start if the temperature of any sensor is higher than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMAX.

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TMIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: Temperature calibration for each sensor will ignore data if the temperature is lower than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMIN.

parameter.name: SYS_FAC_CAL_MODE
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, future sensor calibrations will be stored to /fs/mtd_caldata. Note: this is only supported on boards with a separate calibration storage /fs/mtd_caldata.

parameter.name: SYS_FAILURE_EN
parameter.long_desc: If enabled allows MAVLink INJECT_FAILURE commands. WARNING: the failures can easily cause crashes and are to be used with caution!

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_BARO
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a barometer
parameter.long_desc: Disable this if the board has no barometer, such as some of the Omnibus F4 SD variants. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a barometer.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_MAG
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a magnetometer
parameter.long_desc: Disable this if the board has no magnetometer, such as the Omnibus F4 SD. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a magnetometer.

parameter.name: SYS_HITL
parameter.short_desc: Enable HITL/SIH mode on next boot
parameter.long_desc: While enabled the system will boot in Hardware-In-The-Loop (HITL) or Simulation-In-Hardware (SIH) mode and not enable all sensors and checks. When disabled the same vehicle can be flown normally. Set to 'external HITL', if the system should perform as if it were a real vehicle (the only difference to a real system is then only the parameter value, which can be used for log analysis).

parameter.name: SYS_MC_EST_GROUP
parameter.long_desc: Set the group of estimators used for multicopters and VTOLs

parameter.name: SYS_PARAM_VER
parameter.long_desc: This is used internally only: an airframe configuration might set an expected parameter version value via PARAM_DEFAULTS_VER. This is checked on bootup against SYS_PARAM_VER, and if they do not match, parameters from the airframe configuration are reloaded.

parameter.name: SYS_RESTART_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Set by px4io to indicate type of restart

parameter.name: WV_GAIN
parameter.long_desc: The desired gain to convert roll sp into yaw rate sp.
